snippet: Tenants making less than $100,000 a year may benefit, but Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s office has yet to offer enough details to determine the savings per household.
abstract: New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo is proposing new tax break for tenants in state making less than $100,000 annually; cut would benefit nearly 80 percent of 3.3 million renter households in New York, saving more than $400 million a year; housing experts say plan would only begin to address imbalance in tax policy that has historically favored state's homeowners over renters.
lead_paragraph: Tenants making less than $100,000 a year may benefit, but Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo’s office has yet to offer enough details to determine the savings per household.

headline.main: Among Cuomo’s Proposals, a Tax Break for Renters
headline.print_headline: Among Cuomo Proposals, A Tax Break for Renters
